messages.message:
I'm getting
```File "/Users/dominicfannjiang/instabase/webserver/webapp/build/py/manage_webapp.py", line 66, in <module>
    webapp.init_oidc_client()
  File "/Users/dominicfannjiang/instabase/webserver/webapp/build/py/instabase/webapp/server/main.py", line 58, in init_oidc_client
    sys.exit(f'[init_oidc_client]: Invalid OIDC configs')
SystemExit: [init_oidc_client]: Invalid OIDC configs```
When trying to start webapp locally. @Arek could this related to your changes (https://github.com/instabase/instabase/pull/55739)?
ah wait, let me add your oidc configs to my setup..
Although i am surprised that google auth or oidc is enabled on a fresh instance
Nvm yeah, if you could actually just change the local .env to make it so that ENABLE_GOOGLE_AUTH is false
ah yup it worked! im starting aihub locally without the `--as-aihub` flag, so I needed to add your configs to the `"local"` configuration in `env-local.json`
are you saying we should change `ENABLE_GOOGLE_AUTH` to be false generally speaking? or is it just a workaround
Generally for local, but not for aihub
I believe that's the current setup. `env-local.json` has `ENABLE_GOOGLE_AUTH=true` only in `aihub-local`
